intro: Pentarrhinum, commonly known as the five-horned plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal or five-lobed leaves and showy, often colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually bisexual and consist of five petals, which are often arranged in a radial symmetry. Pentarrhinum species are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage and blooms.
